items.title: Introducing Surya, a new heliophysics foundation model
items.content_text: IBM and NASA open-source a new AI foundation model for the Sun that could change how we look at solar flares.

items.title: Towards a generative future for computing
items.content_text: IBM is exploring a future where generative AI isn’t limited to what’s in the prompt window.

items.title: Building software for quantum-centric supercomputing | IBM Quantum Computing Blog
items.content_text: Explore open-source tools that IBM and its partners are creating to enable seamless integrations of quantum and classical high-performance computing resources.

items.title: Improving AI agent reliability with BeeAI
items.content_text: The RequirementAgent from the BeeAI Framework is an innovative approach that provides the reliability needed for production scenarios made simple.

items.title: Register for the new Qiskit v2.X developer certification | IBM Quantum Computing Blog
items.content_text: Updated Qiskit developer certification exam tests your ability to perform essential quantum computing tasks with the latest version of Qiskit.

items.title: IBM researchers win prestigious European grants
items.content_text: Ghazi Sarwat Syed and Gregor Seiler add to IBM Research’s strong history with European Research Council grants.

items.title: Ado: The accelerated discovery orchestrator
items.content_text: The new platform for computational experiments at scale.

items.title: IBM further strengthens Granite for enterprise deployment with HackerOne
items.content_text: IBM is partnering with HackerOne to offer a bug bounty program for Granite, with up to $100,000 in bounty payouts available. The objective is to identify successful jailbreaks of Granite models deployed in enterprise-like settings with guardrails enabled, as businesses look to scale their AI workflows.

items.title: Can AI generate truly novel algorithms?
items.content_text: A decades-old approach to measuring algorithmic complexity could provide a window into better understanding how AI systems compute.

items.title: Updates on the IBM Quantum Credits program | IBM Quantum Computing Blog
items.content_text: Apply today for free access to cutting-edge IBM quantum capabilities
